intro: Heurlinia variabilis, commonly known as the variable heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and cranberries. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, depending on the variety. Heurlinia variabilis thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
